data.name: richTextBox_CircumscribedradiusFormula.Text
data.value:
Definition. The circumscribed circle of a rectangle (circumcircle) circle which passes only four vertex of the angle and has a center at the intersection of the diagonals of the rectangle.
◦ Using sides:
R = √(a² + b²) / 2
◦ Using perimeter and rectangle side:
R = √(p²-4Pa+8a²) / 4 R = √(p²-4Pb+8b²) / 4
◦ Using area and rectangle side:
R = √(A²+a⁴) / 2a R = √(A²+b⁴) / 2b
◦ Using diagonal:
R = d / 2
◦ Using sine of the angle that adjacent to the diagonal and the opposite side of the angle:
R = a / 2sinα
◦ Using cosine of the angle that adjacent to the diagonal and the adjacent side of the angle:
R = b / 2cosα
◦ Using sine of the acute angle between the diagonals and the area of a rectangle:
R = √(2A /sinB) / 2

data.name: richbox_AreaFormulas.Text
data.value:
Definition. The area of a rectangle the space is restricted rectangle sides or within the perimeter of a rectangle.
◦ Using rectangle sides:
A = a · b
◦ Using perimeter and rectangle side:
A = (Pa - 2a²) / 2 A = (Pb - 2b²) / 2
◦ Using diagonal and rectangle side:
A = a √(d² - a²) = b √(d² - b²)
◦ Using angle between the diagonals and the diagonal of a rectangle:
A= (d² * sin β) / 2
◦ Using radius (circumradius) and rectangle side:
A = a √(4R² - a²) A = b √(4R² - b²)

data.name: richTextBox_PerimeterFormulas.Text
data.value:
Definition. The perimeter of a rectangle is the sum of the lengths of all rectangle sides.
◦ Using rectangle sides:
P = 2a + 2b = 2(a + b)
◦ Using area and rectangle side:
P = (2A+2a²) / a P = (2A+2b²) / b
◦ Using diagonal and rectangle side:
P = 2(a + √d² - a²) P = 2(b + √d² - b²)
◦ Using circumscribedradius and rectangle side:
P = 2(a + √(4R² - a²)) P = 2(b + √(4R² - b²))

data.name: richTextBox_DiagonalFormula.Text
data.value:
Definition: The diagonal of a rectangle is any segment that connects two opposite vertices of a rectangle.
◦ Using rectangle sides (by the Pythagorean theorem):
d = √(a² + b²)
◦ Using area and rectangle side:
d = √(A²+a⁴) / a d = √(A²+b⁴) / b
◦ Using perimeter and rectangle side:
d = √(P²-4Pa+8a²) / 2 d = √(P²-4Pb+8a²) / 2
◦ Using circumscribedradius of ractangle:
d = 2R
◦ Using sine of the angle that adjacent to the diagonal and the opposite side of the angle:
d = a / sin α
◦ Using cosine of the angle that adjacent to the diagonal and the adjacent side of the angle:
d = b / cos α
◦ Using sine of the acute angle between the diagonals and the area of a rectangle
d = √(2A / sin β)

data.name: richTextBox_SidesFormulas.Text
data.value:
Definition: ⦿The length of rectangle is called the length of the longer pair of its sides.
⦿ The width of rectangle is called the length of the shorter pair of its sides.
◦ Using diagonal and another rectangle side:
a = √(d² - b²) b = √(d² - a²)
◦ Using area and another rectangle side:
a = A / b b = A / a
◦ Using perimeter and another rectangle side:
a = (P - 2b) / 2 b = (P - 2a) / 2
◦ Usingf diagonal and angle α:
a = d * sinα b = d * cosα
◦ Using diagonal and angle β:
a = d * sin(β / 2) b = d * cos(β / 2)

data.name: richTextBox_Properties.Text
data.value:
◦ An opposite sides of the rectangle are equal.
◦ An opposite sides of the rectangle are parallel
◦ An adjacent sides of the rectangle are always perpendicular:
◦ All four angles of the rectangle is right
◦ The sum all of the angles of a rectangle is equal to 360 degrees:
◦ A diagonals of the rectangle are equal:
◦ The sum of the squares two diagonals is equal to the sum of the squares of the sides:
◦ The each diagonal divides the rectangle into two equal shape, namely a right triangle.
◦ A diagonal of a rectangle in half divides each other:
◦ Intersection point of the diagonals is called the center of the rectangle and also a center of the circumcircle (incenter).
◦ Diagonal of a rectangle is the diameter of the circumcircle.
◦ Around the rectangle can always describe a circle, because the sum of the opposite angles is 180 degrees:
◦ In rectangle with the different size of sides never enter the incircle.
